p: Results: The overall incidence of AKI was 6 % (n = 21). The mean age was 70.9 ¡¾ 12.5 years and 80.9 % were males. Also initial intervention was done embolization (n = 5, 23 %, P < 0.01), and operation (n = 7, 33 %, P < 0.45). 10 AKI patients were need to receive renal replace therapy. (47 %) Independent risk factors associated with traumatic AKI were injury severity score (ISS) [odds ratio (OR) = 1.084, P < 0.01], presence of shock (OR = 3.78, P = 0.018), and increasing of the serum creatine kinase (CK) (OR = 1.123, P < 0.01) level. Hospital mortality was higher in AKI group (23 %) than not (1 %).
